name: IELTS
purpose: The purpose of the IELTS (International English Language Testing System) is to assess and evaluate the English language proficiency of non-native speakers. It is widely recognized and used by educational institutions, governments, and employers around the world to ensure that individuals have the necessary language skills for studying, working, or living in an English-speaking environment.
targetAudience: Non-native English speakers seeking higher education, employment, or migration opportunities.
test_type: IELTS offers two types of tests: Academic for those pursuing higher education, assessing academic English skills, and General Training for individuals migrating or working, focusing on everyday English for social or workplace settings. Both tests cover Listening, Reading, Writing, and Speaking.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the IELTS exam for higher education?
faq.answer: The IELTS Academic test is designed to assess your English proficiency for higher education, evaluating your ability to understand complex academic texts and communicate effectively in academic settings.

faq.question: What is the difference between the IELTS Academic and General Training tests?
faq.answer: The IELTS Academic test is for those applying to universities or higher education institutions, while the General Training test is for individuals seeking to migrate or work in English-speaking countries.

faq.question: How is the IELTS exam scored?
faq.answer: IELTS is scored on a band scale from 0 to 9, with each section (Listening, Reading, Writing, and Speaking) contributing to your overall band score.

faq.question: What skills are tested in the IELTS exam?
faq.answer: The IELTS exam tests four key skills: Listening, Reading, Writing, and Speaking, to evaluate your ability to use English in academic or general contexts.

types.description: Designed for individuals applying to higher education institutions or seeking professional registration in English-speaking countries.
Aimed at individuals migrating to English-speaking countries for work, training, or secondary education.
For those who need to demonstrate English-speaking and listening skills at CEFR levels A1 or B1, often for UK visa applications.

format.focus: Understanding main ideas and factual information in spoken English.
Comprehension of academic texts (Academic) or everyday material (General).
Writing essays, reports, or letters depending on the type of IELTS.
Ability to communicate effectively in spoken English.

name: TOEFL
abbreviation: Test of English as a Foreign Language
purpose: The TOEFL exam measures the English language proficiency of non-native speakers. It is widely accepted by universities, colleges, and institutions around the world to evaluate academic English skills for higher education purposes.
targetAudience: Non-native English speakers applying for higher education in English-speaking countries.
test_type: TOEFL offers a single test format focused on academic English, assessing listening, reading, writing, and speaking skills through integrated tasks.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the TOEFL exam?
faq.answer: The TOEFL exam assesses your ability to use and understand English at the university level, ensuring you can communicate effectively in academic settings.

faq.question: How is the TOEFL exam scored?
faq.answer: TOEFL scores range from 0 to 120, with individual section scores ranging from 0 to 30.

faq.question: What skills are tested in the TOEFL exam?
faq.answer: TOEFL tests four skills: Reading, Listening, Speaking, and Writing, all of which are essential for academic success.

types.description: The most common TOEFL test, taken online, assesses academic English skills for university admissions.

format.focus: Reading comprehension of academic texts.
Understanding spoken English in academic contexts.
Communicating effectively in spoken English.
Writing essays and integrated writing tasks based on reading and listening material.

name: PTE
purpose: The PTE exam assesses the English language proficiency of non-native speakers for academic purposes. It is widely used for university admissions and immigration applications in English-speaking countries.
targetAudience: Non-native English speakers seeking admission to educational institutions or applying for visas in English-speaking countries.
test_type: PTE offers a single test format that evaluates Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing skills through integrated tasks in an academic context.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the PTE exam?
faq.answer: PTE assesses your ability to use English effectively in an academic environment, ensuring you can understand and produce academic English.

faq.question: How is the PTE exam scored?
faq.answer: PTE scores range from 10 to 90, with a score for each of the four skills as well as an overall score.

faq.question: What skills are tested in the PTE exam?
faq.answer: PTE tests Speaking, Listening, Reading, and Writing skills, with tasks designed to mirror academic situations.

types.description: The most common version of PTE, designed for individuals seeking to study abroad or migrate to an English-speaking country.

format.focus: Speaking and writing tasks based on reading and listening material.
Reading comprehension and task responses.
Listening comprehension and summarizing spoken content.

name: GRE
purpose: The GRE is a standardized test used for admissions to graduate programs. It measures verbal reasoning, quantitative reasoning, and analytical writing skills, commonly required by universities in the United States.
targetAudience: Individuals seeking admission to graduate programs in the U.S. or other countries that recognize GRE scores.
test_type: GRE offers a general test, which includes sections on Verbal Reasoning, Quantitative Reasoning, and Analytical Writing.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the GRE exam?
faq.answer: The GRE assesses verbal, quantitative, and analytical reasoning skills required for success in graduate school.

faq.question: How is the GRE exam scored?
faq.answer: The GRE is scored on a scale of 130 to 170 for the Verbal and Quantitative sections, with an Analytical Writing score from 0 to 6.

faq.question: What skills are tested in the GRE exam?
faq.answer: The GRE tests Verbal Reasoning, Quantitative Reasoning, and Analytical Writing skills, which are essential for graduate-level academic success.

types.description: The standard GRE test, required for admissions to most graduate programs, focusing on verbal, quantitative, and writing skills.

format.focus: Vocabulary, reading comprehension, and sentence completion.
Mathematical reasoning, problem-solving, and data analysis.
Essay writing and analysis of complex issues.

name: SAT
purpose: The SAT is a standardized test used for college admissions in the United States, assessing readiness for college-level work in reading, writing, and mathematics.
targetAudience: High school students applying for college admissions in the U.S.
test_type: The SAT consists of two main sections: Evidence-Based Reading and Writing (EBRW), and Math, with an optional Essay section.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the SAT exam?
faq.answer: The SAT assesses academic readiness for college, testing your skills in reading, writing, and mathematics.

faq.question: How is the SAT exam scored?
faq.answer: The SAT is scored on a scale of 400-1600, combining scores from the Reading and Writing section and the Math section.

faq.question: What skills are tested in the SAT exam?
faq.answer: The SAT tests reading comprehension, mathematical problem-solving, and writing skills.

types.description: The standard SAT test, required for college admissions, assessing reading, writing, and mathematics skills.

format.focus: Reading comprehension and writing skills.
Algebra, problem-solving, and data analysis.
Essay writing and analysis.

name: ACT
purpose: The ACT is a standardized test used for college admissions in the United States, measuring a student's academic skills in English, math, reading, and science, with an optional writing section.
targetAudience: High school students applying for college admissions in the U.S.
test_type: The ACT offers a single test format, consisting of English, Math, Reading, and Science sections, with an optional Writing section.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the ACT exam?
faq.answer: The ACT measures your academic readiness for college, assessing your knowledge in English, math, reading, and science.

faq.question: How is the ACT exam scored?
faq.answer: The ACT is scored on a scale of 1 to 36, with an optional Writing section scored separately.

faq.question: What skills are tested in the ACT exam?
faq.answer: The ACT tests skills in English, mathematics, reading, science reasoning, and optionally, writing.

types.description: The standard ACT test, assessing skills in English, math, reading, and science, with an optional Writing section.

format.focus: Grammar, punctuation, and sentence structure.
Algebra, geometry, and trigonometry.
Reading comprehension and analysis.
Data analysis, scientific reasoning, and interpreting scientific information.
Essay writing and argument analysis.

name: PTE
purpose: The PTE exam assesses the English language proficiency of non-native speakers for academic purposes. It is widely used for university admissions and immigration applications in English-speaking countries.
targetAudience: Non-native English speakers seeking admission to educational institutions or applying for visas in English-speaking countries.
test_type: PTE offers a single test format that evaluates Listening, Reading, Speaking, and Writing skills through integrated tasks in an academic context.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the PTE exam?
faq.answer: PTE assesses your ability to use English effectively in an academic environment, ensuring you can understand and produce academic English.

name: Duolingo
purpose: The Duolingo English Test is an online assessment designed to evaluate English language proficiency for academic and professional purposes.
targetAudience: Students and professionals seeking to demonstrate their English proficiency for universities or job applications.
test_type: Duolingo offers an adaptive test that assesses Listening, Reading, Writing, and Speaking skills.

faq.question: How long does the Duolingo test take?
faq.answer: The test takes approximately 60 minutes and provides results within 48 hours.

name: GMAT
purpose: The GMAT is a standardized test used for admission to business schools and MBA programs. It assesses analytical, writing, quantitative, verbal, and reading skills.
targetAudience: Individuals seeking admission to graduate business programs, including MBA programs.
test_type: GMAT consists of four sections: Analytical Writing, Integrated Reasoning, Quantitative, and Verbal Reasoning.

faq.question: What is the scoring range for GMAT?
faq.answer: GMAT scores range from 200 to 800, with each section contributing to the final score.

name: APT
purpose: The APT is designed to evaluate students' academic proficiency in various subjects, including mathematics, science, and language skills.
targetAudience: Students preparing for higher education admissions or academic assessments.
test_type: APT includes multiple-choice and essay-based questions covering key academic subjects.

faq.question: What subjects are covered in the APT?
faq.answer: The test covers mathematics, science, language skills, and logical reasoning.

name: OET
purpose: OET is designed for healthcare professionals to assess their English proficiency in medical and healthcare settings. It is recognized by regulatory healthcare bodies for registration and licensing purposes.
targetAudience: Healthcare professionals, including doctors, nurses, and pharmacists, seeking to work in English-speaking healthcare environments.
test_type: OET assesses Listening, Reading, Writing, and Speaking skills, focusing on healthcare-related scenarios.

faq.question: What is the purpose of the OET exam?
faq.answer: OET tests English proficiency in a healthcare context, ensuring that professionals can communicate effectively in medical settings.

types.description: Designed specifically for healthcare workers, covering real-life medical scenarios.

format.focus: Understanding patient and professional conversations in healthcare settings.
Comprehension of healthcare-related texts.
Writing referral letters or case notes for medical professionals.
Role-play conversations with patients and colleagues.
